Israeli reservists called up to Gaza torn between doubt and duty
subhead: Tens of thousands of reservists have been called up to carry out Israel's ground offensive in Gaza City. A minority have refused, questioning the aims of a war that began two years ago after the attack by Hamas. Others have responded without hesitation.
byline: By Raphaëlle Rérolle (Jerusalem, Tel Aviv (Israel) special correspondent)

title: Venezuela offers military training to civilians amid Trump's threats of 'incalculable' consequences
South Korea eyes constitutional reform amid fears of abuse of executive power
Democratic leaders in Congress demand a meeting with Trump as a government shutdown looms
subhead: While Democrats are pushing to preserve healthcare programs before the September 30 funding deadline, they maintain that Republicans are refusing to enter talks per Trump's insistence. On Friday, the US president said that there could be 'a closed country for a period of time.'

title: French senator accused of drugging colleague will resign next month
subhead: Senator Joël Guerriau is facing trial for allegedly using ecstasy to spike National Assembly Deputy Sandrine Josso's drink, with the intention of sexually assaulting her. Guerriau denies the charges, describing the incident as a 'handling error.' Josso said the news of Guerriau's resignation had left her in 'disgust': 'This is not an act of responsibility or decency. It's a strategic retreat.'

title: Grenoble, Strasbourg and Rennes top France's ranking of bike-friendly cities
subhead: After surveying thousands of riders, cycling advocates on Thursday released their ranking of France's most bike-friendly cities, aiming to shape debate ahead of the 2026 municipal elections.

title: The silent and destructive spread of laughing gas: 'That shit took my whole life'
subhead: A boy barely out of his teens, a man not yet 30, a young nursing assistant, a father: All share how their lives have been shattered by nitrous oxide. This legal, inexpensive and easily accessible substance has become a widely consumed and addictive drug.

Laure Foucher: 'Israel is doing everything it can to exclude France from the Middle East'
subhead: Laure Foucher, a specialist in Israeli foreign policy, explains in an interview with Le Monde how Israel's project for regional hegemony is clashing head-on with France's strategic interests.

title: French protestors caught between anger and disillusionment
subhead: Eight days after the 'Block Everything' protest movement on September 10, the union coalition called for mobilization against 'austerity' on Thursday, September 18. More than 250 gatherings took place across France, demanding a change in political direction and greater tax justice.
byline: By Camille Bordenet (Besançon (eastern France), special correspondent), Benjamin Keltz (Morlaix (northwestern France), special correspondant), Géraldine Houot, Aline Leclerc, Thibaud Métais, Violaine Morin, Eléa Pommiers, Gilles Rof (Marseille (France) correspondent) and Florence Traullé (Dunkirk (northern France), special correspondent)

title: In Israel, a heated debate over accusations of genocide in Gaza slowly emerges
subhead: For most Israelis, the idea that their army could have committed genocide in Gaza remains unthinkable. But for a few intellectuals, shocked by the scale of the carnage and destruction, this characterization now seems justified.

title: The imperative of recognizing the State of Palestine
Unions are at the heart of the French political equation
Michel Duclos, former diplomat: 'Recognizing a Palestinian state is a step toward a peace'
